com.github.errantlinguist.io
Class FileLineReader<L,F>

java.lang.Object
  com.github.errantlinguist.io.FileLineReader<L,F>
Type Parameters:
L - The object type representing the line data.
F - The object type representing all of the file data.
public class FileLineReader<L,F>
extends Object

A file reader class which reads in a data file or a directory of files, parses it/them, and returns an object representing the data therein.

Since:
2011-07-06
Version:
2011-07-06
Author:
Todd Shore

Method Detail

estimateMaxDirectoryCount

private static final int estimateMaxDirectoryCount(File file)
A simple heuristic to guess the number of directories in a directory tree.

Parameters:
file - A File object representing the root of the tree to estimate the size of.
Returns:
The estimated size, measured as the number of estimated sub-directories.

getDirContents

private static final List<File> getDirContents(File indir)
Makes a List of files in a directory and any of its sub-directories.

Parameters:
indir - The directory to be listed.
Returns:
A List of File objects representing all matching files in the directory and its sub-directories.

getDirContents

private static final List<File> getDirContents(File indir,
                                               FilenameFilter filenameFilter)
Makes a List of files in a directory and any of its sub-directories.

Parameters:
indir - The directory to be listed.
filenameFilter - A FilenameFilter denoting the filenames to be matched.
Returns:
A List of File objects representing all matching files in the directory and its sub-directories.

readDir

public final Map<String,F> readDir(File indir)
                            throws IOException,
                                   ParseException
Reads the files contained in a given directory and returns the data contained therein as a new Map of objects.

Parameters:
indir - The directory of files to be read.
Returns:
A Map of filenames as keys with objects as values representing the input files.
Throws:
IOException - If the indir is not a valid directory or another I/O error occurs.
ParseException - If there is an error parsing the contents of a file.

readDir

public final Map<String,F> readDir(File indir,
                                   FilenameFilter filenameFilter)
                            throws IOException,
                                   ParseException
Reads the files contained in a given directory which match a given FilenameFilter and returns the data contained therein as a new Map of objects.

Parameters:
indir - The directory of files to be read.
filenameFilter - A FilenameFilter denoting the filenames to be read.
Returns:
A Map of filenames as keys with objects as values representing the input files.
Throws:
IOException - If the indir is not a valid directory or another I/O error occurs.
ParseException - If there is an error parsing the contents of a file.

                             throws IOException,
                                    ParseException
Reads the file or directory denoted by a given path which match a given FilenameFilter and returns the data contained therein as a new Map of objects.

Parameters:
inpath - The path to be read.
Returns:
A Map of filenames as keys with objects as values representing the input file(s).
Throws:
IOException - If inpath is not a valid path or another I/O error occurs.
ParseException - If there is an error parsing the contents of a file.

readPath

public final Map<String,F> readPath(File inpath,
                                    FilenameFilter filenameFilter)
                             throws IOException,
                                    ParseException
Reads the file or directory denoted by a given path which match a given FilenameFilter and returns the data contained therein as a new Map of objects.

Parameters:
inpath - The path to be read.
filenameFilter - A FilenameFilter denoting the filenames to be read in the case that the path refers to a directory.
Returns:
A Map of filenames as keys with objects as values representing the input file(s).
Throws:
IOException - If inpath is not a valid path or another I/O error occurs.
ParseException - If there is an error parsing the contents of a file.

readPath

public final Map<String,F> readPath(String inpath,
                                    FilenameFilter filenameFilter)
                             throws IOException,
                                    ParseException
Reads the file or directory denoted by a given path which match a given FilenameFilter and returns the data contained therein as a new Map of objects.

Parameters:
inpath - The path to be read.
filenameFilter - A FilenameFilter denoting the files to be read in the case that the path refers to a directory.
Returns:
A Map of filenames as keys with objects as values representing the input file(s).
Throws:
IOException - If inpath is not a valid path or another I/O error occurs.
ParseException - If there is an error parsing the contents of a file.
